content.raw:
Here’re results from lowering the camera by 0.08m in -z for X4:

RGBD camera \(e.g. X4 config 2\) - propellers no longer visible.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/2545005207-x4_config_2_cam_z.png)
‌

But for HD camera \(e.g. X4 config 1\) - the propellers are still visible due to the wider FOV. I tested with larger -z and also moving a little in \+x but the propellers are still in the view.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/3318059367-x4_config_1_cam_z.png)
‌

I think like before, we’ll need to get consensus from the teams in order to make this change.

cc @{5cf75629ff02b50ea27b2817}
content.html:
Here’re results from lowering the camera by 0.08m in -z for X4:

RGBD camera (e.g. X4 config 2) - propellers no longer visible.

‌

But for HD camera (e.g. X4 config 1) - the propellers are still visible due to the wider FOV. I tested with larger -z and also moving a little in +x but the propellers are still in the view.

‌

I think like before, we’ll need to get consensus from the teams in order to make this change.

cc @Alfredo Bencomo

content.raw:
I appreciate the changing of the camera position to avoid or minimize disturbance by the propellers. But there are also light issues. The current lights can only illuminate a part of the picture that is taken by a HD camera. You cannot see it very good in the example above, but you can see it on the example below taken with a dual camera config \(config 5\). It would be good if the lights could be adjusted \(e.g. bigger cone of light\) to better illuminate the HD-camera pictures.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/1444852343-limited_illuminaten_of_HD-cameras.png)
If the placement of the single camera will be changed, also the dual cameras \(config 5\) should be checked for a better placement.

At last only a minor comment: If I understand it correct, the new position of the single camera is under the copter between the legs. It looks like that it is hovering without any connection to the copter. Looks for me a bit unrealistic.
content.html:
I appreciate the changing of the camera position to avoid or minimize disturbance by the propellers. But there are also light issues. The current lights can only illuminate a part of the picture that is taken by a HD camera. You cannot see it very good in the example above, but you can see it on the example below taken with a dual camera config (config 5). It would be good if the lights could be adjusted (e.g. bigger cone of light) to better illuminate the HD-camera pictures.

If the placement of the single camera will be changed, also the dual cameras (config 5) should be checked for a better placement.

At last only a minor comment: If I understand it correct, the new position of the single camera is under the copter between the legs. It looks like that it is hovering without any connection to the copter. Looks for me a bit unrealistic.

content.raw:
Is it possible to add optional parameters for mounting points for certain sensors \(i.e. camera\)?  As long as they’re within some specified bounds or it defaults to the default parameter there should not be an exploit opened up by this.

Luckily there is a configuration that allows the camera to unobstructed for X3 but this is not the case for X4.  If the competitors were able to change the location of the camera on X4 themselves to decide how much they are willing to have obstructed that would increase the amount of versatility.  Moving the camera forward in body-frame X will have an impact on the control of the vehicle which is fine due to the current state of `cmd_vel` being forces as opposed to velocities feeding into some black-box autopilot.
content.html:
Is it possible to add optional parameters for mounting points for certain sensors (i.e. camera)? As long as they’re within some specified bounds or it defaults to the default parameter there should not be an exploit opened up by this.

Luckily there is a configuration that allows the camera to unobstructed for X3 but this is not the case for X4. If the competitors were able to change the location of the camera on X4 themselves to decide how much they are willing to have obstructed that would increase the amount of versatility. Moving the camera forward in body-frame X will have an impact on the control of the vehicle which is fine due to the current state of cmd_vel being forces as opposed to velocities feeding into some black-box autopilot.

content.raw: @{557058:10b01d41-a2e9-4a41-a907-e6e2f03b6cd5} Dropping the camera down by 0.08 m would probably work fine for our needs.  I think we should wait for consensus from all teams, like you said.
content.html: @Ian Chen Dropping the camera down by 0.08 m would probably work fine for our needs. I think we should wait for consensus from all teams, like you said.

content.raw:
I have lowered the camera for X4 Config 1 to 4 and added a camera mount so that it’s not just floating in mid air. The updated models have been uploaded onto fuel. Clear your cache to force redownload the models on next simulation startup:

`rm -fr ~/.ignition/fuel/fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/openrobotics/models/X4\ UAV\ Config\ *`

The dual cameras on X4 Config 5 are already at -0.08m in z but because they have a larger FOV, the propellers are still in the view.

As for having optional parameters for mounting sensors and changing the lighting on the drones, it’s under discussion. cc @{5cf75629ff02b50ea27b2817}
content.html:
I have lowered the camera for X4 Config 1 to 4 and added a camera mount so that it’s not just floating in mid air. The updated models have been uploaded onto fuel. Clear your cache to force redownload the models on next simulation startup:

rm -fr ~/.ignition/fuel/fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/openrobotics/models/X4\ UAV\ Config\ *

The dual cameras on X4 Config 5 are already at -0.08m in z but because they have a larger FOV, the propellers are still in the view.

As for having optional parameters for mounting sensors and changing the lighting on the drones, it’s under discussion. cc @Alfredo Bencomo
